meanings.definition: Having a chalice or cup-like shape.
meanings.sent1: The flower had chaliced petals that curved gracefully.
meanings.sent2: The chaliced goblet sparkled in the sunlight.
meanings.sent3: The chaliced vase looked like it was ready to sip some water.
meanings.sent4: Her chaliced hat shaded her face elegantly.
meanings.sent5: The chaliced design of the lamp added a touch of sophistication to the room.

meanings.definition: Resembling a chalice in form or function.
meanings.sent1: The chaliced candle holder was perfect for the ceremony.
meanings.sent2: The chaliced fountain bubbled with clear water.
meanings.sent3: The chaliced bird feeder attracted many feathered visitors.
meanings.sent4: His chaliced trophy gleamed proudly on the shelf.
meanings.sent5: The chaliced architecture of the building gave it a regal appearance.
